summary: Federal agencies publish thousands of rules every year. To ensure the public has an opportunity to participate in the rulemaking process, agencies solicit comments on proposed regulations. We surveyed 52 program offices at 10 agencies about the comment process. Almost all of them indicated that the process led to at least some substantive changes to their final rules. title: Federal Rulemaking: Information on Selected Agencies' Management of Public Comments
